title: NYPD Officer Shot Over The Weekend Dies
description: Officer Brian Moore, 25, and his partner had pulled up in their unmarked car behind a man who police said was "adjusting an object in his waistband." Moore died today, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said.

title: People's Republic Of Uber: Driving For Connections In China
description: Uber is becoming more popular in China, but many drivers say they don't do it for the money. They say they like the human connection and the freedom.

title: Triage And Treatment: Untold Health Stories From Baltimore's Unrest
description: Shuttered pharmacies and concerns about public safety in Baltimore contributed to health problems ranging from unfilled prescriptions to people delaying care for asthma and diabetes.

title: 'Charlie Hebdo' Staffer Pushes Back Against Writers' Opposition To Award
description: "If you're standing for the freedom of expression, you can't be at one moment for this freedom of expression, and, two or three minutes later, against that," film critic Jean-Baptiste Thoret says.

title: As U.S. Takes Reins Of Arctic Council, Climate Change Will Top Agenda
description: Founded in 1996, the intergovernmental body promotes cooperation in the region and advises governments on issues related to the Arctic.

title: Damaged Art Memorializes Violent Vietnam Era
description: Today is the 45th anniversary of the killing of four students by National Guard troops on the campus of Kent State University.

title: May The Fourth Be With You: 'Star Wars' Fans Celebrate A Faraway Galaxy
description: Yoda, Chewbacca and a phalanx of stormtroopers are all over the Internet today, as fans celebrate Star Wars Day — drawn from a pun on May 4. We've collected some of our favorite postings.

title: Comcast Sees Rising Revenue, Even After Failed Merger
description: The cable giant's revenue is surpassing analyst expectations, after it abandoned plans to merge with Time Warner Cable.

title: Israel Braces For More Protests By Minority Ethiopian Community
description: Police and protesters clashed Sunday during rallies to protest police treatment of Ethiopian-Israelis. Security forces have been deployed in Tel Aviv and Jerusalem to try to prevent further violence.

title: Last Days Of Dave: Paying Homage To Letterman's Weird And Quirky Legacy
description: The off-beat funnyman retires this month after 33 years hosting late-night television. Fresh Air's David Bianculli says that David Letterman's humor "provided a new blueprint for the TV talk show."

title: Silence On The Sidelines: An MLB Insider's 'Manifesto' On Youth Sports
description: Baseball's Mike Matheny speaks with Fresh Air's Dave Davies about his playing career, managing in the big leagues and the pressures of youth sports. Matheny is the author of The Matheny Manifesto.

title: So You Think You Had A Bad Day?
description: Every day this week, we're checking in with Michael Farquhar, whose new book documents a bad thing that happened every day of the year.

title: Baltimore Photographer Captures Zeitgeist
description: Devin Allen is a self-taught, 26-year-old photographer whose photos bring the world to the streets of the city.

title: Song Premiere: Farao, 'Hunter'
description: An ethereal voice and the sparkle of electronics introduce a new singer from Norway whose avoids the trap of some electronic production — repetition.

title: Diary Of An Oil Worker Fighting To Keep His Job
description: Former journalist Neil LaRubbio is one of the workers trying to hang on to his job, as oil companies cut back on workers and drilling rigs.
